title: Please help ID this nice font?
content:
Hello there!

Does anyone perhaps know what typeface this is?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713085204im_/http:/typophile.com/files/construction_6633.png)

I would appreciate any help, as I really like this font!

Thanks in advance,  
Reinhardt

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [construction.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713085204/http:/typophile.com/files/construction.png) | 12.95 KB |
author: Reinhardt

comments.content: Not an exact match, but quite close to [Revolution Gothic Extra Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713085204/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/revolution-gothic/).

Hi Atwe,

Thank you for you prompt reply!  
Indeed it is a close match, but the differences are still too prominent... I'll keep it in mind for a last resort though.

Thanks!

Jan, sir you are a legend! Thank you very much.

**Without sounding like an @ss:**  
I need only the "square" font for what I need to do, you don't know where I can find that font by any chance?  
It's for a concept that I would like to present to a potential client, but dropping 100 dollars on a font is way out of my budget!

Can anyone help?

You could just purchase [PG Square](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713085204/http:/www.antreposhop.com/product/public-gothic-square) alone or look for the initial demo/beta version Antrepo released a while back.

If you don’t need the whole family, the square set will set you back $30. [http://www.antreposhop.com/product/public-gothic-square](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713085204/http:/www.antreposhop.com/product/public-gothic-square "http://www.antreposhop.com/product/public-gothic-square")

Yes, if you can't afford a font, don't pirate it.

hhp

Unless someone still has the old beta version around _- and is willing to share it -_ my only option is to purchase.

Thank you all anyway for the answers and help identifying the font, it's much appreciated!
